t: Prayer for Mercy in Time of Trouble.
For the choir director; with stringed instruments, upon an eight-string lyre. A Psalm of David.
O*pn Lord,*s do not rebuke me in Your anger, Nor*ln chasten me in Your wrath.
Be*ln gracious to me, O Lord,*s for I am*i pining away; Heal*ln me, O Lord,*s for my bones are dismayed.
And*ln my soul is greatly dismayed; But*ln You, O Lord*s â€”how long?
Return,*ln O Lord,*s rescue my soul; Save*ln me because of Your lovingkindness.
For*ln there is no mention of You in death; In*ln Sheol who will give You thanks?
I*ln am weary with my sighing; Every*ln night I make my bed swim, I*ln dissolve my couch with my tears.
My*ln eye has wasted away with grief; It*ln has become old because of all my adversaries.
Depart*ln from me, all you who do iniquity, For*ln the Lord*s has heard the voice of my weeping.
The*ln Lord*s has heard my supplication, The*ln Lord*s receives my prayer.
All*ln my enemies will be ashamed and greatly dismayed; They*ln shall turn back, they will suddenly be ashamed.
